content: acorn lantern page 1 acorn lantern finished size approx 3 5cm yarn note i used dk yarn for the cap and 4-ply for the nut but any of the lighter-weight yarns work well as long as you knit with needles that range from 2 25-3 00mm anything larger than that will result in an acorn that s too large for the balloon light the following is what i used yarn yarn a nut tiny amount 4-ply weight in acorn nut colour i used drops nord drops alpaca and cardiff cashmere classic from my stash yarn b cap tiny amount 4-ply/ dk weight in acorn cap colour i used drops nord drops alpaca and cardiff cashmere classic from my stash knitting needles 4 x size 2 25mm/ us size 1 dpns double-pointed needles see note on page 2* gauge 14 row x 10 stitches over 2 5cm/ 1in with 2 25mm/ us size 1 knitting needles and yarn a extras led round ball balloon lights either warm or white light glue to stick plastic to yarn pin or sewing needle *to make the initial hole in the balloon light s stopper yarn sewing needle suppliers balloon lights similar from here - amazon © claire garland © dot pebbles knits acorn lantern page 2 acorn lantern page 3 pattern notes & tips general abbreviations *these lanterns work best knitted in the round as it creates a seamless nut k = knit which works best when the little light is switched on p = purl however if you prefer to knit flat then i have also added a pattern for that increase = increase method from page 8 in fact - why not try both they are so quick to knit decrease = decrease k2tog/ k3tog = knit two together/ knit three together p2tog/ p3tog = purl two together/ purl three together rh/lh = right hand/ left hand rs/ws = right side/ wrong side st/ sts =stitch/ stitches skpo = slip one stitch knit next stitch pass slipped stitch over knit stitch to decrease by one stitch kfb = knit into front then into back of stitch to increase by one stitch pfb = purl into front then knit into back of stitch to increase by one stitch here is a code to use for 20% off my new version frog & toad pattern - the pattern is similar to my previous frog pattern although there are clearer images on how to add wires and also some clothes patterns included code is autumnfrogandtoad20 code is also active in etsy 20% off frog and toad plus clothes pattern acorn lantern page 4 acorn lantern page 5 begin here join the nut to the stopper the very first thing to do is to take out the white stopper that which switches the light off/ you now need to secure the stopper against the nut so that it won t pull out on from the balloon light and very carefully make a hole in the centre
